servinfo.title: Valves and Cylinder Head Removal and Installation

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Valves and Cylinder Head Components:For M16A Engine with VVT

s1.ptxt: Remove engine assembly from vehicle referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Remove oil pan referring to Oil Pan and Oil Pump Strainer Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Remove cylinder head cover referring to Cylinder Head Cover Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Remove timing chain cover referring to Steps 3) to 13) of “Removal” in Timing Chain Cover Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Remove timing chain referring to Steps 2) to 6) of “Removal” in Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Remove intake and exhaust camshafts referring to Steps 3) to 8) of “Removal” in Camshaft, Tappet and Shim Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Loosen cylinder head bolts in such order as indicated in the figure by using a 12 corner socket wrenches and remove them.

attention3.ptxt: Don’t forget to remove bolt (M8) (1) as shown in the figure.

s1.ptxt: Check all around cylinder head for any other parts required to be removed or disconnected and remove or disconnect whatever necessary.
Remove exhaust manifold referring to Exhaust Manifold Removal and Installation (For M16 Engine Model) , if necessary.
Remove cylinder head with intake manifold and exhaust manifold. Use lifting device, if necessary.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Valves and Cylinder Head Disassembly and Assembly:For M16A Engine with VVT

s1.ptxt: Clean mating surface of cylinder head and cylinder block. Remove oil, old gasket and dust from mating surface.
Install knock pins (1) to cylinder block.
Install new cylinder head gasket (2) to cylinder block. “Top” mark or “Triangle/circle” provided on gasket comes to crankshaft pulley side, facing up (toward cylinder head side).
Make sure that oil jet (venturi plug) (1) is not clogged. If it is not installed, install it as specified torque.
Install cylinder head to cylinder block.
Apply engine oil to new cylinder head bolts and tighten them gradually as follows.

attention3.ptxt: If cylinder head bolt (M10) is reused, make sure to check cylinder head bolt (M10) for deformation referring to “Cylinder Head Bolt” under Cylinder Head Inspection:For M16A Engine with VVT .

s2.ptxt: Tighten cylinder head bolts (“1” – “10”) to 20 N·m (2.0 kgf-m, 14.5 lbf-ft) according to numerical order as shown by using a 12 corner socket wrenches.
In the same manner as in Step a), tighten them to 40 N·m (4.0 kgf-m, 29.0 lbf-ft).
Turn all bolts 60° according to numerical order in the figure.

attention3.ptxt: Be sure to tighten M8 bolt “A” after securing the other bolts.

torqueitem.t-note: 20 N·m (2.0 kgf-m, 14.5 lbf-ft), 40 N·m (4.0 kgf-m, 29.0 lbf-ft) and then retighten by turning through to 60° twice

s1.ptxt: Install camshafts, tappet and shim referring to Camshaft, Tappet and Shim Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Install timing chain referring to Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Install timing chain cover referring to Timing Chain Cover Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Install cylinder head cover referring to Cylinder Head Cover Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Install oil pan referring to Oil Pan and Oil Pump Strainer Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
